The Lincoln Penny was first issued in 1909 to commemorate Abraham Lincoln's 
100th birthday. It was the first American coin to bear a president's image on its 
face. Lincoln is facing to the right because that was the direction he was facing in 
the photograph Victor David Brenner used to make his bas-relief for the penny.
